intro: Galium grande, commonly known as great bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features slender, ascending stems that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pale pink flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium grande typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
